intro: Pedicularis elongata subsp. julica, commonly known as the long-stalked lousewort, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. This subspecies thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
